snippet: After more than a decade of organized effort to recruit women for the construction trades, few women in California have succeeded in breaking into such jobs through the state's broad network of certified apprenticeship programs.    Statistics comp...
lead_paragraph: After more than a decade of organized effort to recruit women for the construction trades, few women in California have succeeded in breaking into such jobs through the state's broad network of certified apprenticeship programs. Statistics compiled by advocates for women seeking the jobs show that the number of women who are able to get the training to become plasterers, bricklayers and sheet metal workers remains very low.

headline.main: Scant Success for California Efforts To Put Women in Construction Jobs

byline.original: By KATHERINE BISHOP, Special to The New York Times
